newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: OPG, Nycomed win approval for cancer drug.
newsitem.headline: OPG, Nycomed win approval for cancer drug.

text.p: Dutch pharmaceuticals group OPG said on Friday its joint venture Yew Tree Pharmaceuticals had won approval from the Dutch authorities for its breast and ovarian cancer drug Yewtaxan.
"Because of this Dutch registration, the product can now be exported to various countries," said OPG, which owns 50 percent of Yew Tree. Norway's Nycomed holds the other half.
Yewtaxan uses paclitaxel, which is extracted from the yew tree, as its active ingredient. The new drug will be produced in Yew Tree's plants in Britain and the Netherlands.
OPG said approval to use paclitaxel in the treatment of other types of cancer was expected shortly.
"An extensive European clinical programme has started to extend indications for treatment with Yewtaxan," the Dutch group said in a statement.
